result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randolph L. Vestal

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 9:50 AM: 22CF305, 22CF763. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Randolph L. Vestal appeared by video, in custody from Green Bay Correctional.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Randolph L. Vestal.  Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/14/22 at 1:45 PM.
RTN: 12/8/22 at 9:30 AM.
It is ordered that Attorney Richard Yonko is withdrawn as counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Dated 09/19/2022, Letter from Attorney Richard Yonko to Court regarding request to withdraw as counsel.

9:54 AM cases 22CF763, 22CF305 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Randolph L. Vestal not in court, is currently in custody at Dodge Correctional, but did not connect via Zoom.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Randolph L. Vestal.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
